Topic.Title: YHOO will head to 20 - 22. Not rocket science.

Message.Msg: $ 27 by 12/7/12-hope you're not one of the past that predicted 20 billion from Facebook! what will propel it by this date? sales-no (hopefully they are up even a little)! earnings-no (even with buy back)! japan assets-no (will give it a boast hopefully to18-19)! acquiisition-no (most will be for technology (at a premium cost with little earnings)! remaining alibaba assets-yes or more esp.if marissa is successful but you're talking about months or a couple yrs. away for the ipo-not 12-7-12! buy out-YES! so if you're talking about a buy out by 12-7-12 then it makes sense!

Topic.Title: OH! OH! CRAMER SAYS BUY

Message.Msg: leave my saviour alone! my favorite stocks were always at $30-50 & quality! my friend cramer advised (during 2008-9) to sell! he not only KEPT telling every one to sell but even at $3-5 he continued to beat this drum- almost CONTINUOUSLY! i bought a load of preferred ( paying 30% or more dividend ) at 5.00 & loads of common at $3.00. i was mostly out of the market because of the economy & had the money waiting for this opportunity from past experience. sold the preferred later in 2009 at around 21-22 & common over $20.00! i can't thank him enough but i did feel very sorry for the people that listened to him & lost a lot taking his advise at that time! i'm sure they wouldn't of listened to me anyways i love that guy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'll admit it's very SCARY that he likes this company even though i won't let it affect my shares.

Topic.Title: NTWK $6.35 ..Up 2% ….Hottest NASDAQ stock….Up every day since record earnings/strong guidance.....Just the start of a prolonged rally to double digits.....Fundamentals can support $16 per analysts......Technicals looking better each day......Cloud Division is growing exponentially.....only 6 PE and 1 times sales is 30% of sector average......Very cheap considering the recent steady growth and strong guidance of over 30% revenue growth and $1/share net income in 2013.....3M share float

Message.Msg: Nice 6% gain today after last week pause to build a stronger foundation for a sustained rally to $15++ - Average analyst target price: $16/share after most recent upgrade - Huge earnings expected in 4 weeks per guidance (Fiscal 1Q 2013 ended September 30, 2012) - 2013 guidance is for 30 - 40% revenue increase over fiscal 2012 and $1/share net income!! - Cloud Divisions growing exponentially - Very high margins - SAP-certified - The float has only 4 million shares - Strong Institutional and insider ownership. Insiders bought over 5% of the outstanding shares since 2010 in the open market and never sold a single share. The CEO is the largest single buyer

Message.Title: 7.75% government backed preferred
Message.Msg: CYS-A CYS Investments Inc., 7.75% Series A Cumulative Redeemable Preferred Stock, liquidation preference $25 per share, redeemable at the issuer's option on or after 8/3/2017 at $25 per share plus accrued and unpaid dividends, and with no stated maturity. Cumulative distributions of 7.75% per annum ($1.9375 per annum or $0.484375 per quarter) will be paid quarterly on 1/15, 4/15, 7/15 & 10/15 to holders of record on the record date that will be the first calendar day of the month in which the payment is due (NOTE: the ex-dividend date is at least 2 business days prior to the record date). Upon the occurrence of a change of control the company will have the option within 120 days to redeem the preferred shares at $25 per share plus accrued and unpaid dividends.

Message.Title: YAHOO IS NOT AN ELEPHANT!
Message.Msg: There is an article in today's NY Times that talks about large hedge funds either having to find suitable investments or give back their money to investors (and lose the fees). They are looking for "elephants" - places where they can spend a lot of money at once. Unfortuately, Yahoo is not an elephant! With its revolving door for overpaid, ineffective executives; its high turnover - hands off Board of Directors; its dysfunctional policies regarding the various features; and its large number of free-loading users (like me) who never spend a dime on this site -- nobody will touch this company and certainly not at a price that some would like to think that Yahoo is worth. I am especially disappointed in the new Board that seems to be following the same ineffective policies of the people they replaced. Yahoo cannot be managed; it is just too late. It needs to be cut up and sold piece by piece. I don't see that happening any time soon.
